titles.title: United States Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs Act
An act to establish the position of the United States Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs.
A bill to establish the position of the United States Ambassador for ASEAN.
United States Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs Act
United States Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs Act
United States Ambassador for ASEAN Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Lugar with amendments and an amendment to the title. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 457.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments and an amendment to the Title by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in Senate

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

term.name: Advice and consent of the Senate

bill.summary:
United States Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs Act - Establishes in the Department of State the position of U.S. Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs (Association of Southeast Asian Nations).
Expresses the sense of Congress that a Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asia and the Pacific should be designated as the Ambassador for ASEAN Affairs.
